wordpressPost.title: #WorldWaterDay is March 22
wordpressPost.content:
Water and Jobs, Water and Health, Water and You

It’s easy to take Water for granted’easy, that is, until you have too much of it, not enough; or when your water supply is dangerous to use. Then, it’s a problem.
The United Nations estimates that 650 million people worldwide currently have no access to safe water. Put another way, one-tenth of the world’s population is not only thirsty, they’re at at risk of infectious diseases and premature death. The UN further estimates that waterborne diseases are responsible for the deaths of 900 children under the age of five every day.
The 23rd World Water Day is observed on Tuesday, organized by the UN with a fresh report on Water and Jobs; and supported by global partners like Unilever and Colgate actively calling attention to the pervasive urgency for clean water, and creating solutions to alleviate these problems.
“Unilever’s Global Brand Director Barbara Scala decided to take action. Working with Sunlight and NextDrop, she’s helped unlock women’s time with a simple yet life-changing solution ‘ SMS messages.”

Five of our favorite Water Actions’from the hundreds available on WeSpire’s award-winning Behavioral Project Library.

  • Upgrade an older faucet or shower head
  • Set a water savings goal for the office
  • Water plants during the coolest part of the day
  • Skip meat for one meal this week
  • Choose organic cotton when possible

What is your organization doing to celebrate World Water Day?
What’s the H2O situation where you are? We invite you to join the conversation, and please tell us what’s going on at your company to raise awareness and positive impacts for safe and accessible clean water.
